str2: From oregomai; properly, desire, i.e., violent passion (justifiable) abhorrence); by implication punishment.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To uncover, bring to light, reveal. From apo and kalupto; to take off the cover, i.e. Disclose.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Impiety, irreverence, ungodliness, wickedness. From asebes; impiety, i.e. wickedness.
Injustice, unrighteousness, hurt. From adikos; injustice; morally, wrongfulness.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From kata and echo; to hold down, in various applications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Injustice, unrighteousness, hurt. From adikos; injustice; morally, wrongfulness.
